English:
Ouch... Would it have killed you to go a little
easier on me?
Chinese:
痛痛痛……
真是的，大哥哥你都不知道要放點水啊～？
Korean:
아야야야……
정말, 형은 힘조절이라는 말을 모르는 거지~?
German:
Autsch ... Hättest du nicht etwas zarter
mit mir umgehen können?

English:
Hehehe! But my ghost prank was hilarious, don't
you think?
Chinese:
呵呵，不過不過！
像鬼一樣很有趣對吧？
Korean:
후후후, 하지만 하지만!
유령 같아서 재밌었지?
German:
Hehehe! Aber mein Geisterstreich war total lustig,
nicht wahr?

English:
If I didn't control that avatar, it wouldn't do
anything. It's just like a puppet.
Chinese:
這化身，我一沒操作就完全不會動。
你不覺得就像人偶一樣嗎？
Korean:
이 아바타, 내가 조종하지 않으면
까딱도 하지 않아. 인형 같지 않아?
German:
Wenn ich den Avatar nicht steuere, macht er
nichts. Wie eine Marionette.

English:
There's a storage server with loads of avatars
just like this one. That's where this avatar was
being transported to.
Chinese:
有個像保存庫一樣的伺服器專門收集這樣的化身，
這個化身本來也要被搬到那邊去的。
Korean:
이런 아바타가 잔뜩 모여있는
보관 창고 같은 서버가 있어서
이 아바타도 거기로 옮겨지고 있었어
German:
Es gibt einen Speicherserver mit vielen Avataren
genau wie diesem. Dieser Avatar war gerade
auf dem Weg dorthin.

English:
But access to the server is restricted, so I had
to pilfer it before it got there.
Chinese:
不過保存庫伺服器戒備很嚴密，不太可能進去。
所以我在搬送進去前偷了一個出來。
Korean:
근데 보관 창고 서버는 엄중해서 들어갈 수 없을 것 같아서
옮겨지기 직전인 아바타를 하나 슬쩍한 거야
German:
Aber der Zugriff auf den Server ist eingeschränkt.
Also musste ich ihn klauen, bevor er ankam.

English:
Did you think it was a real ghost? Pretty funny,
right?
Chinese:
大哥哥大哥哥，你以為是真的鬼嗎？
一下出現一下消失，很有趣吧？
Korean:
있지 있지, 형은 진짜 유령이라고 생각했어?
나타났다 사라졌다, 재미있지?
German:
Dachtest du, es wäre ein echter Geist? Ziemlich
lustig, was?

English:
Yeah, it was pretty funny.
It wasn't funny. Don't do it anymore.
Chinese:
嗯，很有趣喔
一點也不有趣，快停手
German:
Ja, es war ziemlich lustig.
Es war nicht lustig. Hör auf damit.

Chinese:
是吧，很有趣吧！？
啊哈哈哈哈！

English:
But the price you'll make me pay for my prank will
be twice as scary and five times as funny?
Chinese:
……你說這個惡作劇的代價，
說不定會更恐怖更有趣嗎？
Korean:
……단 이 장난의 대가는
더 무섭고 재미있을 거라고?
German:
Aber der Preis, den ich für meinen Streich zahlen
muss, wird doppelt so beängstigend und fünfmal
so lustig?

English:
Huh? What do you mean?! I like scaring other
people. I don't like being scared myself!
Chinese:
什麼？這話是什麼意思！？
我可不喜歡自己被嚇啊！？
Korean:
뭐어? 무슨 소리야!?
나, 내가 무서워지는 건 싫어!!
German:
Was? Was meinst du damit? Ich mache gern anderen
Angst. Ich selbst mag es nicht, Angst zu haben!

English:
If I stop now, you'll let me off with a warning?
Tsk, fine...
Chinese:
如果我不再玩這樣的遊戲就放過我？
嘖，我知道了啦……
Korean:
다시는 이런 장난을 하지 않으면 못 본 척해주겠다고?
쳇, 알았어~……
German:
Wenn ich jetzt aufhöre, lässt du mir die Sache
durchgehen? Pfff, na schön ...

English:
Hmph, you're boring. Fine, I'll stop! I'll find
something else to amuse me!
Chinese:
嘖，真無聊啊……
那就算了！我再去找別的遊戲！
Korean:
쳇~, 재미없었구나……
그럼 이제 그만둘래! 다른 놀이를 찾을 거야!
German:
Hmpf, du bist langweilig. Na gut, ich höre auf!
Ich werde etwas anderes finden, um mich
zu amüsieren!

English:
Can you take this puppet back where it belongs?
Thanks. Bye!
Chinese:
大哥哥，這個人偶能幫我還回原地點嗎？
那就這樣說好了喔♪
Korean:
형, 이 인형
원래 있던 데에 돌려줄래? 그럼 안녕~♪
German:
Bringst du diese Marionette zurück, wo sie
hingehört? Danke. Tschüs!
